qas.question: When did the Black Death end?
In what period of the Middle Ages did the Black Death occur?
What portion of the European population died in the Black Death?
What era occurred after the Late Middle Ages?
Along with controversy and schism, what upset the peace of the Church during the Late Middle Ages?

context: The <a1_0>Late<a1_0/> Middle Ages was marked by difficulties and calamities including famine, plague, and war, which significantly diminished the population of Europe; between 1347 and <a0_0>1350<a0_0/>, the Black Death killed about <a2_0>a third<a2_0/> of Europeans. Controversy, <a4_0>heresy<a4_0/>, and schism within the Church paralleled the interstate conflict, civil strife, and peasant revolts that occurred in the kingdoms. Cultural and technological developments transformed European society, concluding the Late Middle Ages and beginning <a3_0>the early modern period<a3_0/>.
